subject: Simple multithreaded test case

messageBody:
Hi everyone,

This topic may have been discussed before, but I couldn't find it
anywhere in the FAQ, the forums, or the docs. (The GroboUtils package
is related to this but doesn't seem to specifically address my
question.) The issue is this code:

import junit.framework.*;

public class ThreadTest extends TestCase
{
class Server extends Thread
{
public void run()
{
fail("The server failed its test case");

synchronized (this)
{
notifyAll();
}
}
}

Server server;

public ThreadTest(String name)
{
super(name);

server = new Server();
}

protected void setUp()
{
try
{
server.start();

synchronized (server)
{
server.wait();
}
}
catch (Exception e)
{
fail(e.toString());
}
}

public void testSomething() {}
}

And here's an Ant file for your convenience:

<project name="Thread Test" default="compile">

<target name="compile">
<javac srcdir="."/>
</target>

<target name="runtest">
<junit printsummary="true">
<test name="ThreadTest"/>
</junit>
</target>

</project>

When you look at the source code, it seems quite clear that the test
case should always fail. This is not what happens, however. Although
JUnit prints the correct assertion failure to System.out, it doesn't
report any failures. It thinks that the test succeeded. Is this a bug
in JUnit, or am I just not understanding how it works?

Thanks for any pointers,

Trevor
